p: The minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) data revealed that it ranged from 0.16 to 0.23 µg mL −1, where the bacterial strains can be arranged according to the sensitivity as the following sequence: S. aureus > S. epidermidis > S. typhi > S. pyogenes > E. coli > P. aeruginosa. The EO of Paramignya trimera showed similar inhibition on a set of microbes and, interestingly, the activity revealed the comparable sequence, where S. aureus affected more than E. coli and P. aeruginosa [ 53]. Additionally, the EO of this plant exhibited MIC values 21.00 and 28.00 µg mL −1 against T. shoenlenii and A. fumigatus, respectively ( Table 2).
